items.descriptor: Assess how effectively teams coordinate across programs and value streams
items.raw: Scaled Agile Alignment Assess how effectively teams coordinate across programs and value streams

entries.descriptor: Teams operate independently with no coordination across products or releases.
Coordination happens ad hoc or through informal conversations, often leading to misalignment.
Scrum of Scrums or similar coordination meetings occur, but participation is inconsistent.
Shared backlogs or roadmaps exist but are not updated regularly.
Programs use common planning cadences and shared delivery timelines.
Dependencies between teams are mapped and regularly reviewed.
Teams understand and align around shared product vision and architectural goals.
Teams proactively resolve cross-team blockers and escalate only when necessary.
Value streams and ARTs (Agile Release Trains) are optimized for flow and minimal handoffs.
Program-level metrics and customer outcomes are reviewed collectively across teams.

yesNoInProgress.meta-description: Three options to determine if an action is not started, in progress, or completed
